snippet: The joblessness rate sank to 7.7 percent as 236,000 positions were added across a broad range of sectors, but analysts warned that federal budget cuts could slow the recovery.
abstract: Labor Department reports economy added 236,000 jobs in February as unemployment rate sank to 7.7 percent, lowest level in more than four years; analysts warn that gains, and potential acceleration of economic growth, are being put at risk by automatic spending cuts being imposed by federal government.

byline.original: By NELSON D. SCHWARTZ and BINYAMIN APPELBAUM

lead_paragraph: The joblessness rate sank to 7.7 percent as 236,000 positions were added across a broad range of sectors, but analysts warned that federal budget cuts could slow the recovery.

headline.seo: Jobless Rate Down, Stocks Up, Washington Is Unmoved
headline.main: Unemployment at 4-Year Low as U.S. Hiring Gains Steam
headline.print_headline: Jobless Rate Dips To Four-Year Low; 236,000 Jobs Added
